intro: Polygonum persicaria, commonly known as common knotgrass, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, characterized by its distinctive bead-like seeds and hollow stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often red-veined. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, appearing in late summer. Polygonum persicaria is often found in moist soils along stream banks, wet meadows, and disturbed sites.
